intro: Spergularia tunetana, commonly known as the Tunisian sandspurry, is a flowering plant belonging to the Caryophyllaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb that thrives in sandy and arid environments, typically found in the Mediterranean region. The plant produces small, pink or white flowers that bloom in summer, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous tiny seeds. Its leaves are narrow and succulent, adapted to conserve water in harsh climates. Spergularia tunetana plays a role in stabilizing soils in sandy areas and is of interest in ecological and botanical studies.
